metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14559 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Uncontrolled resource consumption in EDK II may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via network access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14559` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ovmf - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.2
qemu-efi - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.2
qemu-efi-aarch64 - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.2
qemu-efi-arm - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> as of 2020-03-05, two of the upstream bugs still aren't resolved

criterions.comment: edk2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.2').
